RT @OurYoungAddicts: A8 We need treatment pros to learn more about the approaches, particularly aftercare. Often they push the one they kno…
RT @deanokat: A8: When it comes to recovery, success is so hard to measure. Like @KnowAddiction said, it's not a straight line. It's a jour…
A8. Both sides seem to present evidence of being efficacious, and both offer an approach that appeals to a segment of the public. #CADAChat
A6. Can't speak for AA. We like the idea of graduation and moving on with life, and coming back when you need it. #CADAChat
@OhioStateCRC Nice to see you today! #CADAChat
@deanokat Well, ummm, we do too! #CADAChat
A5. For some, certainly, a spiritual approach is attractive but it's not attractive for all. #CADAChat
A4. Life views can be different between individuals. This is why we promote choice for everyone, and not one-way. #CADAChat
A3. No method is a one-sized fits all. For people with an internal locus of control, trying 12 step may be uncomfortable. #cadachat
RT @KnowAddiction: A2: For some AA=perfect fit! They found what they were looking for & if they recovered successfully we shouldn't judge t…
A2. Well, 12 step may have helped them. We believe the individual is ultimately responsible both ways, however. #cadachat
RT @DrugAbuse: @SMARTRecovery For the record, we take a neutral stance on all options! #CADAChat
RT @deanokat: @SMARTRecovery Thanks for weighing in. I agree that choices are fabulous! #CADAChat #recovery
RT @KnowAddiction: We think everyone should find their perfect fit for recovery! (which might not mean AA) #CADAChat @SMARTRecovery
RT @OurYoungAddicts: @SMARTRecovery For certain - whatever works, right? It's great to have options. #cadachat
RT @OurYoungAddicts: @deanokat @SMARTRecovery A lot of people really prefer the SMART approach.  #cadachat
A1. No comment on that one. We believe everyone should have choices.  #CADAChat
